info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Schenectady, northwestern Albany, central Schoharie and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 628 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Schoharie, or 10 miles east of Cobleskill, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Schenectady, Rotterdam, Scotia, Cobleskill, Glenville, Niskayuna, Duanesburg, Altamont, Middleburgh, Schoharie, Richmondville, Delanson, Breakabeen, Rotterdam Junction, Central Bridge, Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction, East Glenville, Knox, Princetown and Esperance. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 25 and 26. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for east central New York.
